diff_hunk:
@@ -2721,11 +2721,13 @@ def batch_gather(params, indices, name=None):
       raise ValueError("batch_gather does not allow indices with unknown "
                        "shape.")
     batch_indices = indices
+    dtype = indices.dtype
     accum_dim_value = 1
body:
Sorry, I now see that the shapes are all computed in Python and this function does not support dynamic shapes. gen_math_ops.cast() inserts a node in the graph to do the cast at graph execution time, which is not what we want here.

I think the proper fix is to simply initialize accum_dim_value to be Dimension(1).  Dimension supports arithmetic operators. See: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/framework/tensor_shape.py#L223

I think the proper fix is to simply initialize accum_dim_value to be Dimension(1). Dimension supports arithmetic operators. See: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/framework/tensor_shape.py#L223
body_text:
Sorry, I now see that the shapes are all computed in Python and this function does not support dynamic shapes. gen_math_ops.cast() inserts a node in the graph to do the cast at graph execution time, which is not what we want here.
I think the proper fix is to simply initialize accum_dim_value to be Dimension(1).  Dimension supports arithmetic operators. See: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/framework/tensor_shape.py#L223
